review_details:
In the water there is sulfur so, if you have a sensitive skin be careful because you may burn your face or your body (it happened to me). Luckily it was not a major burning and it went away after a few days using a treatment bought in the local pharmacy. The beach in itself is really beautiful, the sand color vary from yellow to red. Sometimes there are too many people. The sand is really hot also, so make sure to wear some beach shoes.
You can choose also to rent a beach lounger or you can go on the free side but of course you won't have anything.

I fall in love with this beach. The water was a light blue color and it's so clean that you can literally see the fishes. You can reach this beach only by boat. The boat leaves from Adamas' port and the prices are cheap. I recommend bringing some snorkeling gear, and sun protection.

We decided to explore Mandrakia and being hungry, we decided to stop at this restaurant to eat. We took some zucchini balls which were really good and then we took some fried calamari which I think they had to be a little bit more crispy. The house wine was really good too. The view was amazing, really peaceful and relaxing.

The best day my husband and I spent in Milos. Niko, his wife Frossa and the deckhand Simos are awesome people, we felt like part of the family as soon as we put our feet on the boat. Their hospitality is incredible!

We left from the port of Pollonia and visited the islands of Poliegos and Kimolos and we’ve swum in that clear and beautiful water (it looked like a pool). After this, we fished and then niko’s wife cooked the fresh fish. We had: fish soup, fried fish, salad, wine and bread.
She also prepared some appetizers and a snack for the afternoon.
They also have a big ice chest with water, Coca Cola, lemonade, orange juice, wine and a Greek liquor called “ouzo”.

Far from the basic touristy things to do, this is a real Greek experience full of fun and laughs.
If you come to Milos, you have to make a fishing experience with niko and his crew. It’s a must!!

My husband and I stopped at this restaurant on the way back from Paliochori. It was amazing! The service was fast and the food arrived hot. The grilled feta cheese and the mushroom were delicious! The rosé wine was good also. We were really happy. One of the best places in Milos. We’ll go back!

Un (tardo) pomeriggio, dovevo prendere il treno e un'oretta prima della partenza mi è venuto un 'leggero' languorino, quindi sono andata proprio da chicken spot. Ambiente spazioso e kebab da favola, molto ricchi di condimento. Prezzi nella norma. Uno dei migliori a catania.

Sono andata Napoli con delle amiche e dopo la cena in hotel, andiamo a fare un giro.. All'improvviso sentiamo un leggero languorino allo stomaco, quindi ancora ignare della grandezza della pizza fritta, decidiamo di prenderla. Nonostante fosse fritta, la pizza non era unta di olio e la sua consistenza era perfetta. La prossima volta che tornerò a Napoli, passerò 'Da zia Esterina' senz'altro. La qualità è eccellente ed il prezzo è economico. L'unica pecca è che ci siano pochi tavoli, ma questo non è un problema. Consigliato!
reviewFor: Antica Pizza Fritta Da Zia Esterina Sorbillo

review_details:
C' è un'ampia scelta di gelati tra quelli 'normali', quelli alla soia e quelli per celiaci. Quindi è proprio adatto a tutti. La base dei dessert è il gelato (il mio preferito è la mattonella).
Il personale è cordiale, disponibile e mette a disposizione dei giochi da tavolo. Un ottimo posto in cui andare a mangiare un gelato in dolce compagnia. Qualità-prezzo giusto.

Sono stata a mangiare in questo ristorante con degli amici, ho assaporato del buon pesce essendo fresco, inoltre tutto il personale è stato molto cordiale e attento alle nostre esigenze, cosa che non è da tutti. Lo consiglio vivamente. Da tornarci.
